title: Vegan Paella with Artichokes
description: A vibrant, comforting vegan paella with tender artichoke hearts, smoky paprika, saffron-scented short-grain rice and a medley of roasted vegetables. Cooked in one wide pan to develop a flavorful socarrat, it balances briny capers and lemon brightness for a satisfying plant-based centerpiece.

ingredients.notes: canned or jarred, drained and halved if large
ripe medium tomatoes, finely chopped (or 1 cup canned crushed tomatoes)
about 20-30 threads, steeped in warm broth
optional, for color if saffron is limited
cut into wedges for serving; zest 1 tsp
to adjust liquid if rice absorbs quickly

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: rinse rice briefly and drain; drain and halve artichoke hearts if large; chop onion, mince garlic, slice red pepper, chop tomatoes, measure out spices and heat the vegetable broth and steep saffron threads in a small portion of the hot broth.
Heat a wide paella pan or large sauté pan over medium heat and add olive oil. When shimmering, add diced onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and translucent.
Add minced garlic and sliced red pepper to the pan and sauté until fragrant and the pepper begins to soften.

Stir in chopped tomatoes, smoked paprika, optional turmeric, half the salt and some black pepper. Simmer until tomatoes break down and mixture becomes slightly thickened, about a short simmer to concentrate flavors.
Add the rice to the pan and stir thoroughly to coat each grain with the tomato-spice mixture; toast the rice for a couple of minutes to develop flavor.

Pour in the hot vegetable broth with the steeped saffron (reserve any sediment) and distribute rice evenly. Stir gently once to level, then stop stirring to allow a crust (socarrat) to form later. Adjust heat to maintain a steady simmer.
Arrange artichoke hearts on top of the rice and tuck in the peas; do not stir. Simmer uncovered at medium-low so liquid gently bubbles and rice absorbs, maintaining an even simmer.
About five minutes before the rice is fully cooked, scatter capers over the surface and check liquid level; add small amounts of hot water or broth if the rice appears dry but not yet tender.

Increase heat briefly for 1–2 minutes to encourage socarrat (a toasted bottom crust), then remove from heat and cover the pan loosely with a lid or foil. Let rest so steam finishes cooking the rice and flavors meld.
Uncover, sprinkle chopped parsley and lemon zest, adjust seasoning with remaining salt and pepper, and serve with lemon wedges alongside.
